dict.string: What is the language of Kabbalah?
A means of expressing spiritual attainment through words & letters
Hebrew
Aramaic
Spanish
Which of the following does NOT define an abstract name?
A name given to some phenomenon not by attainment of that phenomenon
A name given out of theorizing or philosophizing, not out of attainment
A name given out of imagination, not out of attainment
A name given to a phenomenon that has been attained
Which of the following statements about abstract names and Kabbalah is incorrect?
There are no abstract names in the language of Kabbalah
Kabbalists sometimes wrote using abstract names when they weren't sure of something
People created abstract names by forming an understanding of Kabbalah without attaining it
Kabbalists have never written using abstract names, but only out of their attainment
Which of the following does NOT clarify the meaning of "Anything we do not attain, we do not define by a name and a word"?
Kabbalists only define what they attain & do not define anything else
Kabbalah is a belief system that has to be believed in order to be felt
Kabbalah is a precise wisdom that needs to be attained in order to be perceived & felt
Kabbalah is attained scientifically as revelation through research
While a Kabbalah student hasn't yet attained spirituality, what should his/her relationship to Kabbalistic terms be?
To study & seek their Kabbalistic definition from Kabbalists, until they become attained
To make up his/her own definitions of the terms
To put Kabbalistic texts aside until one has entered spirituality
To stop studying Kabbalah altogether
Why is it of utmost importance that a Kabbalist writing in the language of Kabbalah doesn't make a single mistake in any word written?
The Kabbalist would then confuse readers in understanding everything connected to that word
The Kabbalist would suffer as a result
It isn't that important, it's ok for a Kabbalist to make a mistake here and there
The Kabbalist would be punished as a result
How can spirituality, which is beyond time, space & motion, be expressed in words & letters, which are within time, space & motion?
It can't
Because our imagination can expand a lot through words to grasp spirituality
Because the words are the key to transpiring time, space & motion
Because of the law of root & branch
Which of the following is NOT an attribute of the law of root & branch?
Everything in spirituality exists also in corporeality, like a seal & its imprint
The only difference between spirituality & corporeality is in the substance
Spirituality and corporeality are exactly the same
Spirituality is the root (cause) of corporeality, which is the branch (consequence)
What is the correct order of worlds from above downward?
Ein Sof » Atzilut » Beria » Yetzira » Assiya » This World
Ein Sof » Beria » Yetzira » Atzilut » Assiya » This World
Ein Sof » Atzilut » Yetzira » Beria » Assiya » This World
Ein Sof » Assiya » Beria » Yetzira » Atzilut » This World
Which of the following does NOT describe the difference between spirituality » corporeality?
Purer » Coarser
More Bestowing » More Receiving
Lighter » Darker
After Death » During Life
